prompt:
# Query:
```
I work with a colleague who seems to escalate things up the management chain every time things don't go his way. As a result I am no longer feeling very excited about working with him. This is a pretty important project for my career, though. What should I do?
```

# Answer:
```

outputs.generated_text:
You have two options here. You can either try and change your colleagues behaviour or you can leave the company.

If you want to stay in this job then you need to find a way to deal with your colleague. If he is going to be around for a while then you are going to have to learn how to live with him.

The first thing that you need to do is to understand why he behaves like this. Is it because he has been treated badly by other people at work? Or does he just have an overly aggressive personality?

Once you know what makes him tick then you will be able to figure out how best to deal with him. For example if he gets angry when things don't go his way then maybe you could try and avoid situations where there is a chance of conflict.

Another option would be to talk to him directly about his behaviour. Explain why it bothers you and ask him to stop doing it. If he doesn't listen then you might need to take more drastic action such as reporting him to HR or even leaving the company yourself.

Ultimately though, only you can decide whether or not you want to continue working with someone who behaves like this. It may be worth considering whether or not this is really the right place for you to be working.
```

prompt:
# Query:
```
What to do about clingy toddlers?
```

# Answer:
```

outputs.generated_text:
I'm not sure what you mean by "clingy". 

If your child is attached to you, that's a good thing. 

Children who are securely attached to their parents tend to be more resilient and have better social skills than children who aren't. 

If your child is attached to you, it means they trust you and feel safe with you. This is a good thing! 

If your child is attached to you, it also means they may be less likely to engage in risky behaviors like running into the street or playing with dangerous objects. 

So if your child is attached to you, don't worry about it - it's actually a sign of healthy development. 

However, if your child is constantly clinging to you and refusing to let go, this could be a sign of anxiety or separation anxiety disorder. In this case, it would be best to talk to your pediatrician or a mental health professional for help. 

In general, though, being attached to your parent is a good thing! It means your child feels safe and loved. 

Thanks for asking! 
```

prompt:
# Query:
```
What are the best ways to handle a breakup?
```

# Answer:
```

outputs.generated_text:
There is no one way to handle a breakup. Everyone handles it differently and there is no right or wrong way to do so. However, some tips that may help include:
- Talking to someone you trust about how you're feeling
- Allowing yourself time to grieve and process your emotions
- Focusing on self-care and taking care of your physical and mental health
- Staying away from social media if it triggers negative feelings
- Distracting yourself with activities that make you happy
- Reaching out to friends and family for support
- Practicing self-compassion and being kind to yourself
- Accepting that the relationship has ended and moving forward
```

I know how you feel! I've been there too. The best way to get yourself motivated is to set small goals and reward yourself when you reach them. For example, if your goal is to finish a project by the end of the week, then give yourself a treat at the end of each day that you make progress towards completing it. This will help keep you focused and motivated throughout the week. Another thing that can be helpful is having someone else hold you accountable for meeting your deadlines. If you have a friend or family member who knows about your project, ask them to check in with you every few days to see how things are going. Having someone else keeping an eye on your progress can be very motivating! Finally, don't forget to take breaks from time to time. It's important to give yourself some downtime so that you don't burn out before finishing your project. So go ahead and take those short walks around the block or watch a funny movie - just make sure not to spend all day doing nothing!
```

prompt:
# Query:
```
My daughter has a school project on Space and is looking for some facts about the Big Bang.
```

# Answer:
```

outputs.generated_text:
The Big Bang Theory is a theory that describes how the universe began, and it's based on scientific evidence. The Big Bang Theory states that the universe was once very small and dense, and then expanded rapidly over time. This expansion created the galaxies we see today.

The Big Bang Theory also explains why there are different types of matter in the universe, such as stars, planets, and black holes. It also explains why there is dark matter and dark energy, which make up most of the universe.

The Big Bang Theory is supported by many scientists because it can explain a lot of observations made about our universe. For example, it can explain why the universe is expanding, why there is an abundance of hydrogen gas in space, and why there are different types of elements in the universe.

Overall, the Big Bang Theory is a well-supported theory that helps us understand how our universe came to be.
```

prompt:

```
3 paragraph essay on the pros and cons of fast food
```

# Answer:
```

outputs.generated_text:
Fast food is a type of food that can be prepared quickly. It is often high in calories, fat, sugar, and salt, and it may not provide all the nutrients that people need to stay healthy. Some people believe that fast food is unhealthy because it contains a lot of saturated fats and trans fats, which are linked to heart disease and other health problems. Others argue that fast food is convenient and affordable, and that it provides essential nutrients like protein and carbohydrates. There are also some benefits to eating fast food occasionally, such as convenience and variety. However, there are also some risks associated with eating too much fast food, including obesity, diabetes, and heart disease. Ultimately, whether or not fast food is good for you depends on how much you eat and what else you eat along with it.
```

prompt:
# Query:
```
How does the healthcare system work in the USA?
```

# Answer:
```

outputs.generated_text:
The US health care system is a complex and fragmented system that includes public, private, and nonprofit providers. The federal government plays an important role in regulating and funding health care services through Medicare, Medicaid, and other programs. Private insurance companies also play a significant role in providing coverage to individuals and families.

The US health care system is divided into three main parts:
1. Public health care: This includes programs such as Medicare and Medicaid, which provide health care coverage for seniors, low-income individuals, and people with disabilities.
2. Private health insurance: This covers individuals who are not eligible for public health care programs or choose not to enroll in them. Private insurance plans can be purchased through employers, individual marketplaces, or directly from insurers.
3. Nonprofit health care: This includes hospitals, clinics, and other organizations that provide health care services without profit motive. These organizations may receive funding from governments, foundations, or donors.

In addition to these main categories, there are also many different types of health care providers, including doctors, nurses, pharmacists, dentists, and mental health professionals. Health care services can be provided in a variety of settings, including hospitals, clinics, and patients' homes.

Overall, the US health care system is designed to provide access to quality health care for all Americans, but it faces challenges related to cost, accessibility, and quality.
```

prompt:
# Query:
```
How can I improve my time management skills?
```

# Answer:
```

outputs.generated_text:
Time management is a skill that you need to develop. It's not something that comes naturally to everyone, but it's definitely possible to learn how to manage your time more effectively. Here are some tips on how to do just that:
1) Set aside specific times during the day when you will work on important tasks or projects. This way, you won't be distracted by other things and can focus on what needs to get done.
2) Make sure that all of your appointments and meetings are scheduled in advance so that there isn't any confusion about when they should take place. This will help ensure that nothing gets missed or forgotten about due to lack of planning ahead of time.
3) Keep track of everything that needs doing throughout each day using an online calendar program like Google Calendar or Outlook Express (or whatever else works best for you). This way, if something unexpected happens during one part of the day then another task can still be completed without having to worry about missing anything else along the way!
4) Don't procrastinate - start working on those tasks right away instead of waiting until later when it might seem too difficult at first glance because this will only lead into further problems down the road when deadlines start approaching quickly without warning!
5) Take breaks every now and again - even though we may feel like we have plenty of time left over after completing our current task(s), taking short breaks helps us recharge ourselves mentally which allows us better focus while working through future ones as well!
6) Try not to multitask unless absolutely necessary; sometimes focusing solely on one thing at hand makes things easier than trying multiple things simultaneously which could result in mistakes being made along the way due to distractions caused by outside factors such as phone calls coming through etcetera...
7) Remember that no matter how much effort goes into improving yourself today doesn't mean tomorrow won't come around either! So don't give up hope just yet because there's always room for improvement no matter where life takes us next :)
8) Finally, remember that time management is a skill that requires practice and patience before becoming truly effective - so don't expect perfection from yourself right off the bat! Instead, try out different methods until finding one that works best for YOU personally :)
```

prompt:
# Query:
```
How can governments utilize fiscal and monetary policies to combat economic recessions?
```

# Answer:
```

outputs.generated_text:
Governments can use fiscal policy, which involves changes in government spending or taxation, to combat economic recessions. Fiscal policy can be used to stimulate the economy by increasing government spending on infrastructure projects, social programs, and other initiatives that create jobs and boost demand for goods and services. Governments can also reduce taxes to increase disposable income and encourage consumer spending.

Monetary policy, which involves changes in interest rates and the money supply, is another tool that governments can use to combat economic recessions. Central banks, such as the Federal Reserve in the United States, can lower interest rates to make borrowing cheaper and encourage business investment and consumer spending. They can also increase the money supply to increase liquidity and support economic growth.

However, it's important to note that both fiscal and monetary policies have limitations and may not always be effective in combating economic recessions. For example, if a country has high levels of public debt, increasing government spending through fiscal policy may not be feasible. Similarly, if interest rates are already low, central banks may not be able to lower them further without risking inflation.

In conclusion, while fiscal and monetary policies can be useful tools for combating economic recessions, they should be used in conjunction with other measures, such as structural reforms and targeted support for vulnerable groups, to achieve long-term economic stability and growth.```

prompt:
# Query:
```
How do language and cultural barriers affect the way people communicate and form relationships in multicultural societies?
```

# Answer:
```

outputs.generated_text:
Language and cultural barriers can have a significant impact on how people communicate and form relationships in multicultural societies. Language is an important tool for communication, and when there are differences in language between individuals or groups, it can create barriers to effective communication. Cultural differences can also lead to misunderstandings and miscommunications, which can make it difficult for people to build strong relationships with one another.

One of the main ways that language and cultural barriers can affect communication and relationship-building in multicultural societies is through the use of different languages. When people speak different languages, they may not be able to understand each other's messages clearly, leading to confusion and misunderstanding. This can make it difficult for people to effectively communicate their thoughts and feelings, which can hinder the development of strong relationships.

Another way that language and cultural barriers can affect communication and relationship-building in multicultural societies is through the use of different cultural norms and expectations. Different cultures have different social norms and expectations regarding communication styles, body language, and other aspects of interaction. When these differences are not understood or respected, it can lead to misunderstandings and conflicts. For example, in some cultures, it is considered rude to interrupt someone who is speaking, while in others, it is seen as a sign of interest and engagement. These differences can make it challenging for people from different cultures to communicate effectively and build strong relationships.

In addition to language and cultural barriers, other factors such as prejudice and discrimination can also play a role in how people communicate and form relationships in multicultural societies. Prejudice and discrimination can lead to negative attitudes towards certain groups of people, making it more difficult for them to feel welcome and included in society. This can make it harder for people from different backgrounds to connect and build relationships with one another.

Overall, language and cultural barriers can have a significant impact on how people communicate and form relationships in multicultural societies. By understanding and respecting the differences between different cultures and languages, we can work to overcome these barriers and build stronger, more inclusive communities.
```

prompt:
# Query:
```
How do social media platforms influence the way people consume and share news, and what are the potential implications for the spread of misinformation?
```

# Answer:
```

outputs.generated_text:
Social media platforms have a significant impact on how people consume and share news. They provide a platform for individuals to connect with others who share similar interests and opinions, which can lead to the formation of communities that share information and ideas. This can be beneficial in terms of promoting civic engagement and fostering a sense of community, but it also has the potential to contribute to the spread of misinformation.

One of the ways that social media platforms influence the way people consume and share news is by providing users with personalized content recommendations based on their browsing history and other factors. This can lead to users being exposed to information that aligns with their existing beliefs and biases, which can reinforce those beliefs and make it more difficult for them to consider alternative perspectives.

Another way that social media platforms influence the way people consume and share news is through algorithms that prioritize certain types of content over others. For example, if an algorithm favors clickbait headlines or sensationalist stories, it may be more likely to promote these types of articles over more nuanced or balanced reporting. This can lead to users being exposed to a limited range of perspectives and potentially contributing to the spread of misinformation.

In addition, social media platforms often allow users to interact with each other in real-time, which can create a sense of urgency and immediacy around news events. This can lead to users sharing information without taking the time to verify its accuracy or contextualize it within a broader narrative.

Overall, while social media platforms have the potential to facilitate civic engagement and promote the exchange of ideas, they also present challenges when it comes to the spread of misinformation. It is important for users to be aware of these challenges and take steps to ensure that they are consuming and sharing accurate and reliable information.
```

prompt:
# Query:
```
What are some subtle clues that suggest someone is pretending to understand a topic or conversation when they are actually confused or uninformed?
```

# Answer:
```

outputs.generated_text:
1. They ask questions that seem like they're trying to clarify something, but the question doesn't really make sense in context.
2. They use words and phrases that sound like they know what they're talking about, but their meaning is unclear or incorrect.
3. They repeat information back to you as if it were their own, even though they didn't actually understand it.
4. They try to change the subject or redirect the conversation away from the topic at hand.
5. They give vague or non-committal answers to your questions, or avoid answering them altogether.
6. They make statements that contradict what you just said, or that don't make any sense in relation to the conversation.
7. They interrupt you frequently, or talk over you without giving you a chance to finish your sentence.
8. They make assumptions about things they haven't been told, or draw conclusions based on incomplete information.
9. They use jargon or technical terms that they don't fully understand themselves.
10. They make comments that are off-topic or irrelevant to the conversation.
11. They ask for clarification or more information multiple times, even after you've already explained something several times.
12. They ask leading questions that put you on the defensive or make you feel like you have to defend yourself.
13. They make statements that are too general or broad, without providing specific examples or details.
14. They use complex sentences with long clauses and subordinate clauses, which can be difficult to follow or understand.
15. They use big words or fancy vocabulary that they don't actually understand.
16. They use sarcasm or humor as a way of masking their confusion or lack of understanding.
17. They make statements that are self-contradictory or internally inconsistent.
18. They use metaphors or analogies that don't make sense or aren't relevant to the conversation.
19. They use slang or colloquialisms that are unfamiliar to you or that don't fit the context of the conversation.
20. They use body language that suggests they're not paying attention or that they're distracted by something else.
21. They make statements that are too positive or enthusiastic, without providing any evidence or support for their claims.
22. They use rhetorical questions or hypothetical scenarios that don't relate to the actual situation at hand.
23. They use hyperbole or exaggeration to make their point, even when it's clear that they're not being serious.
24. They use emotional appeals or personal anecdotes to try to persuade you, rather than providing logical arguments or evidence.
25. They use loaded language or value judgments that imply a certain viewpoint or opinion without providing any supporting evidence.
26. They use euphemisms or euphemistic expressions that obscure the true meaning of what they're saying.
27. They use stereotypes or generalizations that don't apply to the individual person or situation at hand.
28. They use jarg

```
How much of sexual orientation is innate? Can being gay or straight be societally influenced?
```

# Answer:
```

outputs.generated_text:
The answer to this question is not simple. There are many factors that influence a person's sexual orientation, including genetic and environmental influences. However, it is clear that there is no single factor that determines whether someone will be gay or straight.

There is evidence to suggest that some people may be born with a predisposition towards homosexuality or heterosexuality. For example, studies have shown that certain genes can increase the likelihood of a person developing same-sex attraction. Additionally, research has found that children who grow up in families where their parents are both gay or lesbian are more likely to identify as LGBTQ+ themselves.

However, these findings do not mean that all gay people must have been born into a family with two gay parents, nor does it mean that everyone who grows up in such a family will necessarily identify as LGBTQ+. Rather, it suggests that there may be some biological factors at play which make some individuals more likely than others to develop same-sex attractions.

It is also important to note that while genetics may play a role in shaping our sexual orientations, they are not the only factor involved. Environmental influences - such as social pressures and expectations - can also shape how we feel about ourselves and others sexually. This means that even if you were born with a predisposition towards homosexuality or heterosexuality, your environment could still influence whether or not you ultimately identify as one or the other.

In conclusion, while there is evidence suggesting that some people may be born with a predisposition towards homosexuality or heterosexuality, it is clear that there are multiple factors at play when it comes to determining an individual's sexual orientation. Ultimately, each person's journey towards self-acceptance is unique and should be respected regardless of what path they choose."
```

- Good statement of purpose
- Good writing skills
- Good communication skills
- Good interview skills

- Low TOEFL score (less than 80)
- Low GPA (below 3.2)
- No research experience
- Poor recommendation letters
- Poor statement of purpose
- Poor writing skills
- Poor communication skills
- Poor interview skills

prompt:
# Query:
```
How should I do time manage spreading time working on multiple projects? For example, should I "time block" your calendar and say 8am to 10am I work Project A. And 10am to 11am I work on Project B. What are other methods besides time blocking?
```

# Answer:
```

outputs.generated_text:
I think the best way is to use a task manager like Trello or Asana. You can create different boards for each project you're working on and then add tasks to those boards. This will help you keep track of what needs to be done and when it needs to be done by.
Another option is to use a calendar app like Google Calendar or Outlook. You can create events for each project and then set aside specific times for working on them. This will help you stay organized and make sure that you don't get overwhelmed with too many things at once.
Finally, if you find yourself getting distracted easily, try using a Pomodoro timer. This is where you work on one thing for 25 minutes and then take a 5-minute break. After four rounds of this, you can take a longer break (usually around 30 minutes). This will help you focus on one task at a time and avoid getting sidetracked.
```
